text: We studied the functional interaction between human embryonic <extra_id_0> zeta 2 globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and the <extra_id_0> alpha globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulatory element ( HS-40 ) located 40 kb upstream of the <extra_id_0> zeta 2 globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

It was shown by transient expression assay that HS-40 behaved as an authentic enhancer for high-level <extra_id_0> zeta 2 globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity in K562 cells , an erythroid cell line of embryonic and / or fetal origin .

text: Although sequences located between -559 and -88 of the <extra_id_0> zeta 2 globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene were dispensable for its expression on enhancerless plasmids , they were required for the HS-40 enhancer - mediated activity of the <extra_id_0> zeta 2 globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: Site - directed mutagenesis demonstrated that this HS-40 enhancer - <extra_id_0> zeta 2 globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter interaction is mediated by the two <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> factor binding motifs located at -230 and -104 , respectively .
The functional domains of HS-40 were also mapped .

Bal 31 deletion mapping data suggested that one <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> motif , one GT motif , and two NF-E2 / AP1 motifs together formed the functional core of HS-40 in the erythroid - specific activation of the <extra_id_0> zeta 2 globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: Site - directed mutagenesis further demonstrated that the enhancer function of one of the two NF-E2 / AP1 motifs of HS-40 is mediated through its binding to NF-E2 but not AP1 transcription factor .
Finally , we did genomic footprinting of the HS-40 enhancer region in K562 cells , adult nucleated erythroblasts , and different nonerythroid cells .
All sequence motifs within the functional core of HS-40 , as mapped by transient expression analysis , appeared to bind a nuclear factor ( s ) in living K562 cells but not in nonerythroid cells .
On the other hand , only one of the apparently nonfunctional sequence motifs was bound with factors in vivo .
In comparison to K562 , nucleated erythroblasts from adult human bone marrow exhibited a similar but nonidentical pattern of nuclear factor binding in vivo at the HS-40 region .

These data suggest that transcriptional activation of human embryonic <extra_id_0> zeta 2 globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene and the fetal / adult <extra_id_0> alpha globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes is mediated by erythroid cell - specific and developmental stage - specific nuclear factor-DNA complexes which form at the enhancer ( HS-40 ) and the globin promoters .
